meanings.definition: To give strength or courage to
meanings.sent1: The coach nerved the team before the big game.
meanings.sent2: She nerved herself to speak in front of the audience.
meanings.sent3: The superhero nerved up to face the villain.
meanings.sent4: He nerved his resolve to overcome his fear of heights.
meanings.sent5: The motivational speech nerved everyone in the room to take action.

meanings.sent1: The nerved hand felt the warmth of the fire.
meanings.sent2: Her nerved fingers tingled with anticipation.
meanings.sent3: The nerved cat cautiously approached the unfamiliar object.
meanings.sent4: The nerved system responded quickly to the stimulus.
meanings.sent5: The nerved area of the body was sensitive to touch.

meanings.definition: Having a specified kind or number of nerves
meanings.sent1: The nerved creature had a unique ability to sense danger.
meanings.sent2: The plant had nerved leaves that reacted to touch.
meanings.sent3: The nerved structure of the building provided stability in the storm.
meanings.sent4: The nerved system of the robot allowed for precise movements.
meanings.sent5: The nerved animal could detect vibrations in the ground.
